author: madhurt
content: Hi, are the potential ideas for the program decided yet?

author: madhurt
content: Or perhaps, is there a list of parts of the protocol where these potential ideas will lie in?

author: trent_vanepps
content: do you have any ideas you're already interested in?

author: madhurt
content: I am still looking around, but interested generally in the python ecosystem of ETH + also projects for the "merge". Btw, is there work happening on the eWASM front already?

author: trent_vanepps
content:
you could check out the Vyper ecosystem! 

there's a vyper channel in the Crypto Devs server you can start with: https://discord.gg/zY5AZ4hj

> Vyper is a contract-oriented, pythonic programming language that targets the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM).

Docs: https://vyper.readthedocs.io/en/stable/

author: trent_vanepps
content: ewasm is shelved as a research area for now

author: trent_vanepps
content: the merge is a very large project with many parts involving consensus (eth2) and execution (eth1) client teams and many researchers. is there something specific related to that you are interested in?

author: madhurt
content: I am not aware of something specific in this area, but is there a list of those eth2 clients? I see that there is trinity, but the last commit on it was from 2019 so not sure if it's actively being worked on. Also, are there projects which combine let's say data science with Ethereum?

author: trent_vanepps
content: trinity is deprecated, not actively worked on

author: trent_vanepps
content: are you looking at the eth.wiki?

author: trent_vanepps
content: i think we're going to forward that to ethereum.org

author: madhurt
content: even https://github.com/ethereum/trinity-eth2 is depreciated?

author: trent_vanepps
content: yes

author: madhurt
content: yes I was

author: trent_vanepps
content:
yes, there are quite a few, and this is one of the most open areas for people to define their own area of interest. you should check out Dune analytics, for example, here's a dashboard for EIP-1559, a recent upgrade to Ethereum's fee market

https://dune.xyz/yulesa/EIP-1559-KIP

author: trent_vanepps
content: big community around analyzing various types of data extracted from the chain

author: madhurt
content: aah, the one with the base fee (burning) and miner tip, this looks great

author: trent_vanepps
content:
finally, there's more in depth studies that look into simulations.

here's some work from Barnabe Monnot, who works at the EF with the "Robust Incentives Group" RIG https://github.com/ethereum/rig
